headline: Broiled Lobster Tails
description: This lobster tail recipe seasons whole lobster tails with melted butter and paprika, then cooks them under the broiler for a delectable dinner for 2.

video.description: See the simple, less messy way to cook lobster.
video.name: Broiled Lobster Tails

name: Broiled Lobster Tails
recipeIngredient: salt and ground white pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place lobster tails on a baking sheet. With a sharp knife or kitchen shears, carefully cut the top side of lobster shells lengthwise. Pull apart shells slightly, and season meat with equal amounts of melted butter, paprika, salt, and white pepper.
Broil lobster tails until lightly browned and lobster meat is opaque, about 5 to 10 minutes. Garnish with lemon wedges to serve.

review.reviewBody: I SPRINKLE WITH GRATED PARMESAN CHEESE. It's delicious.
No changes no notes

Hey everyone I used to work in the kitchen at a nationwide restaurant chain. Here is how they broiled their lobster tails. The kitchen or prep area would prepare the lobster tails a little different but better I think. As the recipe states, to cut lengthwise down the shell of the tail. Now pull the meat out of shell but still making sure tail still attached at base. On the underside of tail, they call it, "score" or make 3-4 diagonal, superficial, not deep cuts and close or put together shell so you can lay the lobster meat on top of the shell. Then make or score again 3 superficial cuts lengthwise down the meat on top like you did shell when you cut it. I usually make one cut down center and the 2 other along side or just next to center score. Spread out meat again along over shell. Now this recipe calls for butter and some spices but the restaurant I know they used a mixture of butter, chopped parsley, garlic or maybe garlic powder, and maybe that paprika. Mix the spices and brush on meat and cook. At least this way, it thins out the meat a little so you don't have undercooked thick piece of meat in the center and probably cooks faster. I think that restaurant chain had cooked some of their smaller tails the same way as this recipe but majority of the lobster tails are like this. I'm sure everyone knows what restaurant chain that I'm talking about. Good luck and good eating!!

Broiled with tops of lobsters about 4 inches from the heat. Broiled 4.7 oz tails for 6 mins. Perfect. Easy. Delicious. I have made it several times. So easy, so yummy. Bought 3 tails for the 2 of us but ate only 1 each. Served with a lemon almond rice pilaf, kale and spinach mandarin feta salad. Great meal.
I had a one pounder and it came out perfect with approx 7 mins
Had never cooked lobster before and this was a really great way to cook it. Lots of flavor and very tender!

So stupidly simple! I had no idea how easy it was to make delicious lobster! Only tough part is learning how to cut the tail correctly. I used one of my husbands tools from his tool set cause the scissors weren’t cutting it (no pun intended). Next time I will see if the butcher can help me get a nice clean cut, everything else you can do with your eyes closed.
Tails turned out great, cooked perfectly. But the recipe needs a little something spicy hot to kick it up. Maybe some old Bay seasoning next time or picante paprika.

This was excellent and the most succulent lobster I’ve had in a long time. I was a little nervous about it - I wanted New Years Eve dinner to be special. I wasn’t sure if the broiler should be high or low so I had it on low for 5 Miki
No changes, delicious results.

The first big red flag on this recipe is the cooking time. 5 to 10 minutes? That's a lot of time difference in broiling fish! I use 1 minute per ounce as a guide. Also, the position of the oven rack is very important. Should be about 10 inches from heat source. In general, the flavoring is good, but this is a very poorly written recipe that will not be of help to anyone new to lobster tail broiling.

I didn’t like this at all. There is no way to accurately broil a lobster, the meat is too fragile. The inside was cooked correctly but top was over done and chewy. It was also pretty bland despite doubling the seasoning. I love 99% of the dishes I have made from Allrecipes, but this one was a thumbs down. An expensive dish that did not taste delicious. I would not recommend.
Excellent!

Once you’ve prepped your lobster tails (cut down center of spine and removed membranes) place two-three fingers into the underside of the shell in order to lift the meat into the top of the shell. This allows you to season and butter the meat as well as enhancing the visual when plated.

Made recipe, recipe to vague. Lobster was under cooked after 15 minutes and broiler at 650. Cooked another eight minutes one over cooked the other way over cooked. 
Need size of lobster and where to place oven as well as time per ounce and broil setting.

This is my go to method of cooking lobster. I’ve used this recipe many times now. It’s closer to 10 minutes to cook than 5 but I like to make sure it is fully cooked through. Great recipe to make lobster rolls too.
I used Old Bay for seasoning. Good recipe. But, then it's hard to screw up Lobster. Good thing because it is so expensive.
This was so simple and so tasty. I did not used the paprika but otherwise made it true to the recipe. I wil make this again. My husband really liked the lobster tails prepared this was.
Try using old bay seasoning instead of paprika. Otherwise perfect. Will never steam another lobster.
Was delicious!
Perfect
This was the easiest part of my meal to make albeit expensive, but tons cheaper than going out!

Turned out great! Salt, pepper, butter and some Old Bay is all you need to enhance the wonderful natural flavor of lobster. While broiling we really watched them to not overcook. We first had it on low on a low rack in oven but then increased it to high to finish it off. We usually steam lobster but this will be our method from now on.
This recipe was easy and very tasty. The only change I made was in the seasoning I added a little cayenne pepper with the paprika . It was fabulous.
Absolutely will make it again, my wife loved it!
These turned out great following the recipe exactly. My son-in-law said they were the best lobster tails he's ever had.
It was easy to follow, easy to do. I would omit the salt next time.
Ok
No changes this time around.
Turned out Great!!!
A great recipe. I added garlic.
This was an easy and delicious way to cook lobster! I ended up having to use lemon juice instead of lemons, but it was just as good.
This was delicious and easy. Beware the salt. My lobsters (frozen) came already salty whatever the store did to them. I use some fresh chopped garlic in the butter and Old Bay instead of paprika.
simple and delicious
Very Simple, Very Good, Very Easy.
Delicious and easy to make!!
Turned out Ah-mazing!!

Super easy! I used to steam my tails and they would always curl up. This is definitely the best method for presentation. Unfortunately I did not get a chance to take a fully presented photo (with the meat pulled up) because the second I put them on a plate, my husband was ready to pounce! He said they were perfect.

I used Old Bay, pink Himalayan salt, freshly ground black pepper, garlic powder, a lemon squeeze, tons of butter and just a sprinkle of raw sugar.
Easy and perfect!

very easy! who knew? I guess you did. lol
I don't have to go to local seafood places and pay 3-4x the price anymore to get my fix

I made no changes, and will definitely make this, again! With an electric oven/broiler, I moved the cooking sheet to the second from the top (cooking element) position. This recipe -- with this timing -- came out perfect! Sweet, tender, and the shells are far easier to cut with kitchen shears than I thought. I think you MUST use real butter, by the way...

Quick, easy and delicious. Made it in my countertop toaster oven (2 tails). Put them in as I was plating Chef John's outstanding recipe for Scallops in Corn Cream. Those two recipes with Basmati Rice and organic mini carrots were my wife's Valentines Day dinner.
Very easy recipe for a newbie- needed to have a little more flavor, but this still tasted good.
Perfect every time

This worked great! Had 4 tails which were about 4 lbs. Put them under the broiler, set them on the second rack and set the timer for 8 minutes based on other reviews saying they took so long. After 3 minutes could smell them and shells were pink. Turned the pan and maybe 3 minutes later shells were starting to blacked so I pulled them and they were cooked perfectly. Left the meat inside the shell to cook also. Clearly depends on how close to the top you set your rack in the oven on the cooking time. Delicious!

No changes 
Went exactly by recipe 
Turned out delicious. 
Will use again
It was good. The shell started burning so I took it out after 10 minutes. It was not completely done in the thicker section. Need to open it up more.

These came out perfectly. It's just important that you don't overcook them. Also, I made 4-7 oz lobster tails and the recipe as written contained enough butter and spices for all four tails. I just put a bit of extra paprika on the top of the lobster meat before broiling. Delicious and thank you.
I broiled for 7 minutes, added Ole Bay seasoning to the mix, and topped with butter before I broiled it. It came out so good!

Cook time turned out a perfect shell... however, prior to broiling (after cutting the shell) I opened the shell and lifted the meat to position it partially atop the shell... Made seasoning the tail easier, and of course it presents more elegantly on plate..
Great recipe! I can’t eat any type of shellfish but I make it for my family. They said it was the best lobster they ever had ! Thanks!!!
Simple and elegant. This recipe accentuates the delicate sweetness of the lobster. Yum! Only adjustment was that I needed to broil them a few minutes longer to gain the opaqueness of the meat.
My new fave prep for lobster. I added Old Bay to the butter mix and it worked great
Simple and delicious. I have used this recipe several times and they always come out perfect.

Made this tonight to rave reviews! A few shakes each of dry spices on each cut lobster tail : powdered garlic, powdered onion and paprika with a drizzle of melted butter on each, about two tbsp total for four tails. Broil highest rack in the oven for 20minutes. Baste with juices from the pan and turn off the oven leaving the door open. Plated some spaghetti (dressed with olive oil, garlic, basil and Parmesan cheese) along with the lobster, just divine. Served with melted butter for dipping.
more broil time will be needed,depending on the size of the tail
My first time making lobster tails. So yummy. Will cut all the way next time and open fully to making eating it as easy as making it.

Easy and delicious. only change was some minced garlic which I sauted in butter and added with the melted butter over the lobster tails before broiling. I served with prosciutto wrapped asparagus and twice baked potatoes from this site. was a big hit with the family!!
Fast and easy and perfect flavor. Better than what I've had in restaurants and not bad considering at home they're only about $5 each!
I would cook a minute and a half less.
Just how it said
For ease of dining, I recommend removing the lobster meat from the shell before plating. Wish the recipe had stated that as we ended up with lobster shell pieces amongst the food.
For Two Lobsters I had top keep putting it back in because each time it was far from 140 degrees. I would say triple the time you state.

Very tasty, kept to the recipe but did use garlic salt for the salt. If you're worried about the cooking time just use 1 min for each oz.. But do keep a watch while under the broiler. At the end when I took the meat out of the tail I let them sit in the lobster juice and melted butter in the pan.

Easy peasy! We love lobster anytime we can get it. This recipe is so easy and delicious. If your tails are larger than 8 oz it will take longer than 5-10 minutes. We will use this recipe again and again!
I also use to boil my lobster but broiling is much more flavorful. Love this recipe.
It was delish!!!! My Valentine was very happy!!!

It was so easy to broil the lobster tails. I squeezed on fresh lime juice because I didn't have lemons. Also I used Nature Seasons instead of salt and pepper. Absolutely delicious, and did I say it was easy??? Yum.

This was the very first time I prepared lobster tails (usually my husband makes these for the family). I was on a tight schedule and had quite a few to feed so I wanted quick, easy and delicious. This recipe delivered on all points! My husband was absolutely floored at how tasty this came out with very little effort on my part. Everyone else raved about it. Didn't change a thing and would make it exactly the same way next time!

I used four lobster tails without doubling the amount of butter. I added garlic to the extra butter and we used it for dipping and on bread. Cutting the shell was a little tricky. I did not find it necessary to re-arrange the oven shelves and they broiled in about 7 minutes.

So simple to make!! Love it. I used 6-7 oz lobster tails, cooked on second rack from bottom, oven on broil (I don’t have a degree on my broiler) i place day a skewer under lobster thru tail length wise while cooking to prevent curling. Leave lobster meat inside shell. I also used Old Bay Seasoning in place of paprika. Cooked mine for 12 minutes and was perfect!! I will definitely use this recipe again. Hope this helps others.

I made this for my husband for Valentine's Day dinner. .... Delicious! I made a few adjusts ... I melted the butter along with the following ... 1 minced clove of garlic, a 1/4 tsp of paprika and a 1/4 tsp of smoked paprika ... I wanted a slightly smokey, sweet flavour while not over powering the other flavours. Yes, the cooking time instructions are vague ... all I can say is, thank goodness for GOOGLE!! *** The rule of thumb is Broil 5-6 inches from the broiler on HIGH ... *** approximately 1.5 MINUTES PER OUNCE *** I had (4) 2 oz tails = 3 minutes but decided to add 2 more minutes for good measure ... for a total of 5 minutes and they turned out perfectly! ... tender and juicy ***Youtube is also a great reference on, How to remove the lobster meat from the shell, how to prep for broiling for the WOW factor !!... LOBSTER TAILS 101 is a good one. This will be a keeper for next year's Valentine's Dinner .

Many reviews had issues with the cook time. I found this helpful from another recipe:
The lobster tails are done when the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees. The meat may be slightly browned but should be firm to the touch.
Bottom line, use a meat thermometer . . .

I also broil mine but add a bit of water to the pan to just cover the bottom to help cook the tails and keep them from curling. If you split the tails press down on one side of the tail and then the other to separate the tail from the shell but not completely. This helps so you can pull the tail up over the shell. Great recipe!
Wasn’t sure how to prepare the small twin frozen lobster tails from TJ’s. After defrosting i followed this recipe, served with drawn butter and the tails were so flavorful.
I've made this a few times now. Following the directions as written and it turns out Perfect every time. Great recipe. Thanks for posting it!
Awesome recipe and easy to do!!!

I have made this recipe for the last 3 years! This is the only way I make lobster, the butter does smoke a lot in the broil so be careful (I used a little bit less butter, a bit more paprika and garlic powder) So good!!

5 to 10 minutes is a joke. I weighed my lobster tails, about .75 oz each and idk if my oven is different or what but 20 minutes later my lobster is still broiling and clear on the bottom. I've never made lobster so this has been a fun adventure trying to tell when its done but i'm confident that clear is a no go lol
Perfect just heat and eat simply awesome

Very good way to broil lobster tails, with just the right amount of seasoning. Did need to follow other reviewers regarding how long to broil for 5-6 oz., as the recipe does not say what size the tails are.....good advice in many of the reviews.
Perfect! I used Old Bays, butter and sea salt. Just perfect. Thank you
This was super simple to make and came out great. This recipe gives many high end restaurants a run for their money. I will definitely be making this again soon
It was wonderfully Good
We loved it. Only change was a bit of Old Bay instead of paprika
Deliscious, not one left on the table. Better than many restaurants.
Love the recipe!! Thank you
Easy and delicious!
Delicious! With a nice juicy steak and garlic butter, ridiculously delicious!
Excellent recipe, as is. My miscue in cooking too long. Still tasty, but not serviceable to guests.
Fast, easy and delicious! This is the first time I've cooked lobster but it won't be the last.
Awesome so delish

My first time cooking lobster. I did as directed and used all ingredients as suggested. I'm kind of queasy about cutting up meat . Once I cut up a whole chicken I didn't eat chicken for at least 6 months and vowed never to buy a full bird again. LOL Breaking the shell on my mini lobster tail was a little eww. Think I'll stick to the pros next time I have a hankering. All in all this recipe was great for my first time. Thank you.

We made the old bay seasoning according to a recipe on allrecipes. 1/4 c of butter and the freshly made seasoning for 16 mins or so was enough for a great result. BroIling in low setting on one level higher than the center rack of the oven was perfect. I checked the lobsters in every 5 minutes without opening the oven door. 3 large tails from CostCo which was 1 lb total, tasted perfect! Thanks for the skewer tip that kept them from curling up, and cleaning the vein/intestine that's on the top. I wouldn't have guessed to do that.
So simple and the timing on the cook time is spot on. Changed a little by drizzling lemon & paprika butter pre-bake. Turned out very tender and delicious.

I read the reviews and was so afraid I would over cook it into hard rubber that I under cooked it, then had to recook it. I agree with everyone else there should be a timer in the recipe like 1 minute for each ounce and more if cooking 4 or more tails at the same time. I've never had problems with shrimp or crab legs, but this made me nervous. I'll keep trying though until I get comfortable with it. :)
"Best lobster tail I have had" That's what she said
I mixed obey and garlic with my butter, my tails were bigger so I broiled them about 30 minutes and they came out perfectly, great recipe it takes the intimidation out and makes cooking them easy.

This is a great lobster recipe... super easy and good! Will make it this way regularly now. I did need to broil it longer than the recipe says. The inside/bottom of the tail wasn't as done as the outside/top, but that could have been my oven. Ended up broiling for 15-20 actually. Not overdone or burnt, so was great! I also lift the tail meat out of the shell, keeping a bit intact at the end, and resting it over the shell for presentation. Love it!
